title: AZ-900 اختبار مايكروسوفت اجور -  from deepseek
titleEn: AZ-900: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals Practice Exam from deepseek
description: A practice test with multiple-choice questions covering key knowledge areas for the AZ-900 certification.

questions.text: Which term describes the provisioning of computing resources (like servers, storage, networking) over the internet?
questions.explanation: Cloud computing is the on-demand delivery of IT resources over the Internet with pay-as-you-go pricing.

questions.text: What is the main difference between containers and virtual machines?
answers: Containers require a guest operating system while VMs don't
Containers don't require a guest operating system while VMs do
Containers are more expensive than VMs
VMs provide better isolation than containers
questions.correctAnswer: Containers don't require a guest operating system while VMs do
questions.explanation: Containers are similar to VMs except they don't require a guest operating system. The application and all its dependencies are packaged into a container.

questions.text: Which cloud service model lets you run application code without creating, configuring, or maintaining a server?
questions.explanation: Serverless computing lets you run application code without creating, configuring, or maintaining a server. You only pay for the processing time used.

questions.text: What is the key characteristic of vertical scaling?
answers: Adding more servers to work as one unit
Adding resources to increase power of existing server
questions.correctAnswer: Adding resources to increase power of existing server
questions.explanation: Vertical scaling, also known as scaling up, is the process of adding resources to increase the power of an existing server, such as adding more CPUs or memory.

questions.text: Which benefit of cloud computing allows automatic addition or removal of resources based on demand?
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows a cloud computing system to automatically add or remove resources as your workload changes due to demand spikes or drops.

questions.text: Capital Expenditure (CapEx) involves upfront spending on physical infrastructure.
questions.explanation: CapEx is the spending of money on physical infrastructure up front, and then deducting that expense from your tax bill over time.

questions.text: Which cloud deployment model involves resources shared by multiple organizations?
questions.explanation: A public cloud is a shared entity where multiple corporations use a portion of the resources in the cloud, like Microsoft Azure.

questions.text: What is the main advantage of hybrid cloud deployment?
answers: Flexibility to run workloads in most appropriate location
questions.correctAnswer: Flexibility to run workloads in most appropriate location
questions.explanation: Hybrid cloud combines public and private clouds, allowing you to run applications in the most appropriate location for security, compliance, or performance reasons.

questions.text: Which service model provides managed infrastructure but requires you to manage applications and data?
questions.explanation: IaaS provides the underlying infrastructure while you manage the operating systems, applications, and data.

questions.text: Azure App Service is an example of which cloud service model?
questions.explanation: Azure App Service is a Platform as a Service (PaaS) offering that enables you to build and host web applications without managing infrastructure.

questions.text: What is the primary use case for Azure Virtual Machines?
questions.explanation: Azure Virtual Machines (IaaS) are commonly used for migrating workloads as they're managed similarly to on-premises infrastructure.

questions.text: Which Azure service helps ensure VM availability during planned maintenance?
questions.explanation: Availability Sets are logical groupings of two or more VMs that help keep applications available during planned or unplanned maintenance.

questions.text: Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets allow you to create and manage identical, load-balanced VMs.
questions.explanation: Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets let you create and manage a group of identical, load balanced VMs that can automatically scale based on demand.

questions.text: Which Azure service is designed for parallel and high-performance computing applications?
questions.explanation: Azure Batch is a managed service for parallel and high-performance computing applications that enables large-scale job scheduling.

questions.text: What is the main difference between Azure Functions and Azure Logic Apps?
answers: Logic Apps require coding while Functions don't
Functions are code-first while Logic Apps are designer-first
Logic Apps only work with Microsoft products
questions.correctAnswer: Functions are code-first while Logic Apps are designer-first
questions.explanation: Azure Functions use a code-first (imperative) approach, while Logic Apps use a designer-first (declarative) approach with predefined logic blocks.

questions.text: Which Azure networking service allows resources to securely communicate with each other?
questions.explanation: Azure Virtual Network allows Azure resources to securely communicate with each other, the internet, and on-premises networks.

questions.text: What feature distinguishes Azure Application Gateway from a simple load balancer?
questions.explanation: Azure Application Gateway provides URL-based routing, cookie affinity, SSL termination, and web application firewall capabilities beyond basic load balancing.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides a dedicated, private connection between your network and Azure?
questions.explanation: Azure ExpressRoute provides a dedicated, private connection between your network and Azure, extending on-premises networks into Microsoft cloud.

questions.text: Azure Blob Storage is optimized for storing structured data.
questions.explanation: Azure Blob Storage is designed for storing very large objects like video files or bitmaps (unstructured data), not structured data.

questions.text: Which Azure database service is globally distributed and supports NoSQL options?
questions.explanation: Azure Cosmos DB is a globally distributed database that supports NoSQL options and can store data updated by users worldwide.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of Azure App Service?
questions.explanation: Azure App Service is an HTTP-based service that enables you to build and host web-based solutions without managing infrastructure.

questions.text: Which Azure service is used for sending push notifications to any platform?
questions.explanation: Azure Notification Hubs send push notifications to any platform from any back end.

questions.text: Azure IoT Hub provides secure communications between and monitoring of IoT devices.
questions.explanation: Azure IoT Hub is a messaging hub that provides secure communications between and monitoring of millions of IoT devices.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides a collaborative Apache Spark-based analytics platform?
questions.explanation: Azure Databricks is a collaborative Apache Spark-based analytics service that integrates with other Big Data services in Azure.

questions.text: What is the main difference between Azure Machine Learning Service and Azure Machine Learning Studio?
answers: Service provides drag-drop interface while Studio requires coding
Studio provides drag-drop visual workspace while Service is code-based
questions.correctAnswer: Studio provides drag-drop visual workspace while Service is code-based
questions.explanation: Azure Machine Learning Studio provides a collaborative, drag-and-drop visual workspace, while Azure Machine Learning Service is a cloud-based environment for developing and managing models with code.

questions.text: Which Azure service helps quickly create on-demand Windows and Linux environments for testing?
questions.explanation: Azure DevTest Labs quickly creates on-demand Windows and Linux environments you can use to test or demo applications.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a resource group in Azure?
answers: To hold related resources for an application solution
questions.correctAnswer: To hold related resources for an application solution
questions.explanation: A resource group is a logical container that holds all the services, disks, network interfaces, and other elements that make up a solution as a unit.

questions.text: Adding more virtual machines to power an application is an example of horizontal scaling.
questions.explanation: Horizontal scaling (scaling out) means adding extra virtual machines to power your application, while vertical scaling (scaling up) means increasing resources on an existing VM.

questions.text: What is an Azure Region?
answers: A geographical area with one or more datacenters
questions.correctAnswer: A geographical area with one or more datacenters
questions.explanation: A region is a geographical area on the planet containing at least one, but potentially multiple datacenters that are nearby and networked together.

questions.text: Which of the following describes Availability Zones?
answers: Multiple regions in the same geography
Multiple datacenters within a region with independent power and cooling
Multiple resource groups in a subscription
questions.correctAnswer: Multiple datacenters within a region with independent power and cooling
questions.explanation: Availability Zones are made up of one or more datacenters equipped with independent power, cooling, and networking within a region.

questions.text: What is the main benefit of Azure region pairs?
answers: Planned updates rolled out one region at a time
questions.correctAnswer: Planned updates rolled out one region at a time
questions.explanation: Planned Azure updates are rolled out to paired regions one region at a time to minimize downtime and risk of application outage.

questions.text: SLA stands for Service Level Agreement and describes Microsoft's commitment to performance standards.
questions.explanation: SLAs describe Microsoft's commitment to providing Azure customers with specific performance standards and uptime guarantees.

questions.text: What is the difference between resiliency and availability?
answers: Availability is recovery from failures, resiliency is uptime
Resiliency is recovery from failures, availability is uptime
Resiliency applies only to storage, availability to compute
questions.correctAnswer: Resiliency is recovery from failures, availability is uptime
questions.explanation: Resiliency is the ability of a system to recover from failures and continue to function. Availability refers to the time that a system is functional and working.

questions.text: Which Azure feature is available to all Azure customers for evaluation purposes?
questions.explanation: Public Preview features are available to all Azure customers for evaluation purposes, while Private Preview is available only to specific customers by invitation.

questions.text: What are the three primary types of data that Azure Storage is designed to hold?
questions.explanation: Azure Storage is designed to hold structured data (adheres to schema), semi-structured data (tags/keys), and unstructured data (no designated structure).

questions.text: Which encryption type is transparent to the user and handled by Azure?
questions.explanation: Azure Storage Service Encryption (SSE) for data at rest encrypts data before storing and decrypts before retrieving, transparent to the user.

questions.text: In an N-tier architecture, lower tiers can access services from higher tiers.
questions.explanation: In N-tier architecture, a higher tier can access services from a lower tier, but a lower tier should never access a higher tier.

questions.text: Which security layer is considered the most fundamental in the defense-in-depth strategy?
questions.explanation: In the security layer model, physical security is the foundation (most depth), followed by identity and access, perimeter, network, compute, application, and data.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of Azure Security Center?
questions.explanation: Azure Security Center provides threat protection across all of your services both in Azure and on-premises, offering security assessments and recommendations.

questions.text: What is the difference between authentication and authorization?
answers: Authentication establishes identity, authorization establishes access level
Authorization establishes identity, authentication establishes access level
Authentication applies to users, authorization to applications
questions.correctAnswer: Authentication establishes identity, authorization establishes access level
questions.explanation: Authentication is establishing identity (who you are), while authorization is establishing what level of access an authenticated identity has.

questions.text: Which Azure AD feature enables users to remember only one ID and password for multiple applications?
questions.explanation: Single-Sign-On (SSO) enables users to remember only one ID and one password to access multiple applications.

questions.text: Multi-factor authentication requires elements from at least two different categories.
questions.explanation: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) requires two or more elements from categories: something you know, something you possess, and something you are.

questions.text: What is a service principal in Azure AD?
answers: A user account with admin privileges
An identity used by a service or application
questions.correctAnswer: An identity used by a service or application
questions.explanation: A service principal is an identity that is used by a service or application, similar to a service account in Windows.

questions.text: Which access control method uses sets of permissions like 'Read-only' or 'Contributor'?
questions.explanation: Role-based access control uses roles which are sets of permissions that users can be granted to access Azure services.

questions.text: What type of encryption uses the same key to encrypt and decrypt data?
questions.explanation: Symmetric encryption uses the same key to encrypt and decrypt data, while asymmetric encryption uses public and private key pairs.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of Azure Key Vault?
questions.explanation: Azure Key Vault is a centralized cloud service for storing application secrets like tokens, passwords, certificates, and API keys.

questions.text: Service certificates in Azure are used for cloud services and enable secure communication.
questions.explanation: Service certificates are used for cloud services and enable secure communication to and from the service, defined in service definition.

questions.text: Which compliance standard is related to health information protection in the United States?
questions.explanation: HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) is a US compliance standard for protecting health information.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the Microsoft Service Trust Portal?
answers: Publishing audit reports and compliance information
questions.correctAnswer: Publishing audit reports and compliance information
questions.explanation: The Service Trust Portal hosts Compliance Manager and is Microsoft's public site for publishing audit reports and compliance-related information.

questions.text: Which tool provides a workflow-based risk assessment dashboard for regulatory compliance?
questions.explanation: Compliance Manager is a workflow-based risk assessment dashboard within the Service Trust Portal that tracks regulatory compliance activities.

questions.text: What is the main function of Azure Monitor?
questions.explanation: Azure Monitor maximizes availability and performance by collecting, analyzing, and acting on telemetry from cloud and on-premises environments.

questions.text: Which Azure Service Health component provides a global view of Azure service health?
questions.explanation: Azure Status provides a global view of the health state of Azure services, while Service Health provides a customizable dashboard for your regions.

questions.text: A resource can be a member of multiple resource groups simultaneously.
questions.explanation: All resources must be in a resource group and a resource can only be a member of a single resource group.

questions.text: What is the maximum number of tags that can be applied to an Azure resource?
questions.explanation: A resource can have up to 50 tags, which are name/value pairs used for organization and automation.

questions.text: Which resource lock setting allows read activities but blocks modification and deletion?
questions.explanation: Read-only resource locks allow only read activities, blocking any modification or deletion of the resource.

questions.text: What primarily determines outbound data transfer costs in Azure?
questions.explanation: Outbound data transfers are priced based on Billing Zones, which are geographical groupings that determine transfer costs.

questions.text: Which Azure tool helps estimate costs for planned Azure services?
questions.explanation: The Azure Pricing Calculator allows you to configure and estimate costs for Azure services before deployment.

questions.text: Azure Advisor provides cost recommendations in which areas?
answers: Multiple areas including reserved instances and underutilized VMs
questions.correctAnswer: Multiple areas including reserved instances and underutilized VMs
questions.explanation: Azure Advisor provides cost recommendations for eliminating unprovisioned circuits, buying reserved instances, and right-sizing underutilized VMs.

questions.text: Reserved instances can save up to 70-80% compared to pay-as-you-go pricing for predictable workloads.
questions.explanation: For static and predictable VM workloads, reserved instances can save up to 70-80% off pay-as-you-go costs.

questions.text: Which tool helps predict cost savings when migrating to Azure?
questions.explanation: The TCO calculator helps predict cost savings when migrating to the cloud by comparing on-premises costs with Azure costs.

questions.text: What is Azure Cloud Shell?
questions.explanation: Azure Cloud Shell is a browser-based command-line experience for managing and developing Azure resources, available in Bash and PowerShell.

questions.text: Which service provides oversight of role assignments and just-in-time role activation?
questions.explanation: Azure AD PIM provides oversight of role assignments, self-service, and just-in-time role activation for Azure AD and Azure resources.

questions.text: What does Azure Disk Encryption help protect?
questions.explanation: Azure Disk Encryption helps encrypt Windows and Linux IaaS virtual machine disks together with Azure Key Vault.

questions.text: Transparent data encryption (TDE) protects Azure SQL Database against malicious activity.
questions.explanation: Transparent data encryption (TDE) helps protect Azure SQL Database and Azure Data Warehouse by performing real-time encryption of databases and backups.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of Azure Information Protection?
answers: Classify and protect documents and emails
questions.correctAnswer: Classify and protect documents and emails
questions.explanation: Azure Information Protection helps organizations classify and optionally protect documents and emails by applying labels.

questions.text: How does Azure Policy differ from RBAC?
answers: RBAC is for resources, Policy for users
Policy is default-allow, RBAC is default-deny
Policy is default-allow-and-explicit-deny, RBAC controls access
questions.correctAnswer: Policy is default-allow-and-explicit-deny, RBAC controls access
questions.explanation: Unlike RBAC which controls access, Azure Policy is a default-allow-and-explicit-deny system that evaluates resources for compliance with policies.

questions.text: What are Azure Management Groups used for?
answers: Managing access, policies, and compliance across multiple subscriptions
questions.correctAnswer: Managing access, policies, and compliance across multiple subscriptions
questions.explanation: Azure Management Groups are containers for managing access, policies, and compliance across multiple Azure subscriptions.

questions.text: Which service helps define a repeatable set of Azure resources that adhere to organizational standards?
questions.explanation: Azure Blueprints enables defining a repeatable set of Azure resources that implements organizational standards, patterns, and requirements.

questions.text: Application Insights monitors the availability, performance, and usage of web applications.
questions.explanation: Application Insights is a service that monitors the availability, performance, and usage of web applications, whether hosted in cloud or on-premises.

questions.text: Which policy effect creates a warning but doesn't stop the resource request?
questions.explanation: The Audit effect creates a warning event in the activity log when evaluating a non-compliant resource, but doesn't stop the request.

questions.text: What is an initiative definition in Azure Policy?
answers: A set of policy definitions grouped together
questions.correctAnswer: A set of policy definitions grouped together
questions.explanation: An initiative definition is a set or group of policy definitions to help track compliance state for a larger goal.

questions.text: Which Azure service provides personalized guidance when Azure service issues affect you?
questions.explanation: Azure Service Health provides personalized guidance and support when issues with Azure services affect you.

questions.text: Data copied to Azure Storage is automatically maintained in at least three copies.
questions.explanation: Azure Storage automatically maintains multiple copies of data to ensure durability and high availability.

questions.text: Which Azure service would you use to map a network drive from Windows computers to Azure Storage?
questions.explanation: Azure Files offers fully managed file shares accessible via SMB protocol, allowing network drive mapping from Windows computers.

questions.text: What is the primary use case for Azure Queue storage?
answers: Queuing and delivering messages between applications
questions.correctAnswer: Queuing and delivering messages between applications
questions.explanation: Azure Queue storage is a data store for queuing and reliably delivering messages between applications.

questions.text: Which Azure service optimizes app server farm delivery while increasing application security?
questions.explanation: Azure Application Gateway optimizes app server farm delivery while increasing application security with features like WAF and SSL termination.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of Azure DDoS Protection?
answers: Protecting against distributed denial of service attacks
questions.correctAnswer: Protecting against distributed denial of service attacks
questions.explanation: Azure DDoS Protection protects Azure-hosted applications from distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks.

questions.text: Azure Traffic Manager distributes network traffic across Azure regions worldwide.
questions.explanation: Azure Traffic Manager distributes network traffic across Azure regions worldwide using DNS to direct users to the closest endpoint.

questions.text: Which Azure networking service monitors and diagnoses network issues?
questions.explanation: Azure Network Watcher monitors and diagnoses network issues using scenario-based analysis.

questions.text: What type of firewall is Azure Firewall?
answers: A fully stateful firewall as a service
questions.correctAnswer: A fully stateful firewall as a service
questions.explanation: Azure Firewall is a managed, cloud-based, network security service that is a fully stateful firewall as a service with built-in high availability.

questions.text: Which Azure service creates a unified wide area network connecting local and remote sites?
questions.explanation: Azure Virtual WAN creates a unified wide area network (WAN), connecting local and remote sites.

questions.text: What do Network Security Groups (NSGs) allow or deny?
answers: Inbound network traffic to Azure resources
questions.correctAnswer: Inbound network traffic to Azure resources
questions.explanation: Network Security Groups allow or deny inbound network traffic to your Azure resources, acting as a cloud-level firewall.

questions.text: The archive storage tier is optimized for data that is accessed frequently.
questions.explanation: The archive storage tier is for data that are rarely accessed and stored for at least 180 days with flexible latency requirements.

questions.text: Which Azure database service is fully managed and scalable with high availability for MySQL?
questions.explanation: Azure Database for MySQL is a fully managed and scalable MySQL relational database with high availability and security.

questions.text: What is Azure Synapse Analytics primarily used for?
questions.explanation: Azure Synapse Analytics is a fully managed data warehouse for running analytics at massive scale across petabytes of data.

questions.text: Which service caches frequently used data to reduce latency?
questions.explanation: Azure Cache for Redis caches frequently used and static data to reduce data and application latency.

questions.text: Azure API Management publishes APIs to developers, partners, and employees securely.
questions.explanation: Azure API Management publishes APIs to developers, partners, and employees securely and at scale.

questions.text: What does IoT Edge allow you to do with data analysis models?
answers: Run them only in the cloud
Push them directly onto IoT devices
questions.correctAnswer: Push them directly onto IoT devices
questions.explanation: IoT Edge pushes data analysis models directly onto IoT devices, allowing them to react quickly without consulting cloud-based AI models.

questions.text: Which Azure service processes massive amounts of data with managed Hadoop clusters?
questions.explanation: Azure HDInsight processes massive amounts of data with managed clusters of Hadoop clusters in the cloud.

questions.text: What is the main advantage of using Azure DevOps?
questions.explanation: Azure DevOps provides development collaboration tools including high-performance pipelines, Git repositories, Kanban boards, and testing.

questions.text: In the shared responsibility model, who is always responsible for data and endpoints?
questions.explanation: Regardless of deployment type, customers always retain responsibility for data, endpoints, accounts, and access management.

questions.text: Which Azure AD tier provides a full suite of security services including continuous monitoring?
questions.explanation: Azure Security Center Standard tier provides a full suite of security services including continuous monitoring, threat detection, and just-in-time access control.

questions.text: Economies of scale refer to the ability to do things more efficiently at larger scale.
questions.explanation: Economies of scale is the ability to do things more efficiently or at a lower-cost per unit when operating at a larger scale.

questions.text: Which factor does NOT typically affect Azure costs?
questions.explanation: Factors affecting costs include resource type, services, location, and billing zones, but not user experience.

questions.text: What is the main benefit of using Azure reservations for VMs?
questions.explanation: Reserved instances provide significant cost savings (up to 70-80%) for static and predictable VM workloads compared to pay-as-you-go.

questions.text: Which support plan provides 1-hour response for critical cases?
questions.explanation: Standard support provides 1-hour response for critical cases, while Professional Direct provides 1-hour response plus priority tracking.

questions.text: Azure Hybrid Benefit can increase savings when combined with reserved instances.
questions.explanation: Using reserved instances plus Azure Hybrid Benefit can save up to 80% in costs compared to pay-as-you-go pricing.

questions.text: What is the primary use case for Azure Content Delivery Network?
answers: Delivering web content with minimal latency
questions.correctAnswer: Delivering web content with minimal latency
questions.explanation: Azure CDN is a distributed network of servers that efficiently delivers web content to users in their local region to minimize latency.

questions.text: Which Azure service would you use to migrate databases to the cloud with no code changes?
questions.explanation: Azure Database Migration Service migrates databases to the cloud with no application code changes.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of Azure Active Directory?
questions.explanation: Azure Active Directory is a cloud-based identity service with support for synchronizing with on-premises AD or used stand-alone.
